p: The reason why RS has less of an anticoagulant effect than heparin is probably as follows. The minimal structure of the AT binding site in heparin has been shown to be GlcNAc-GlcA-GlcN-IdoA-GlcN [ 53]. However, RS does not have a structure like the AT binding site of heparin. Therefore, the binding strength between RS and AT could be about 1/10 that of heparin.
